intro: Oenanthe diffusa, commonly known as the common water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in wet or damp environments such as marshes, stream banks, and roadside ditches. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. Oenanthe diffusa is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs like carrots and parsley.
